sentences.en: Any outside criticism is routinely dismissed as interference.
sentences.cn: 任何来自外界的批评通常都被当作干涉而不予理睬。

sentences.en: Both countries agreed that normal relations would be based on non-interference in each other's internal affairs.
sentences.cn: 两国一致同意正常邦交关系应建立在互不干涉内政的基础之上。

sentences.en: I couldn't hear the program because there was too much interference.
sentences.cn: 因干扰太大,我听不清节目.

sentences.en: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.cn: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

sentences.en: It is hard to imagine her taking kindly to too much interference.
sentences.cn: 很难想象她会喜欢被人过多地干涉。

sentences.en: Many students'error occurs because of mother - tongue interference.
sentences.cn: 许多学生发生这种错误是由于母语的干扰.

sentences.en: My concern for their well - being was misunderstood as interference.
sentences.cn: 我关心他们的幸福,却被误解为多管闲事.

sentences.en: Not unnaturally, Jane greatly resented Harry's interference.
sentences.cn: 很自然地，简对哈利的干预极为不满。

sentences.en: The parliament described the decree as interference in the republic's internal affairs.
sentences.cn: 议会形容此法令为对共和国内政的干涉。

sentences.en: The President took the opportunity to hit out at what he sees as foreign interference.
sentences.cn: 总统借机猛烈抨击了被自己视为外国干涉的行为。

sentences.en: These acts constitute an interference in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.cn: 这种行动构成对别国内政的干涉.

sentences.en: They have been accused of deliberately causing interference to transmissions.
sentences.cn: 他们被指故意干扰信号传输。

sentences.en: We oppose interference by any outside force.
sentences.cn: 我们反对任何外来势力插手干预.

sentences.en: We will brook no outside interference.
sentences.cn: 我们不容许任何外来干涉.

sentences.en: What may seem helpful behaviour to you can be construed as interference by others.
sentences.cn: 在你看来似乎是施助的行为在别人眼中可能就会被解读成一种干涉。

sentences.en: Your interference is an obstruction of justice.

phrases.tran_cn: 相消干涉，相消干扰；破坏性干扰
过盈配合；干涉配合；紧配合
抗干扰能力；干扰抑制；抗干扰度；抗扰性
射频干扰；无线电频率干扰
(美橄)作掩护阻挡。 （见前面义项1）

trans.tran_cn: 干涉，干扰，冲突，介入，妨碍，打扰，阻碍物，冲突，抵触
